title: oma-browser-build pipeline parameters
description: Convert OMA run into OMA Browser release

oma_source.description: Selection of OMA data source. Can be either 'FastOMA' or 'Production'. The selection requires setting either the parameters for FastOMA or Production.

fastoma_species_tree.description: Species Tree in newick format. We recommend using the tree stored in the FastOMA output folder named 'species_tree_checked.nwk'.

fastoma_proteomes.description: Folder where the input fasta files for each proteomes are located.

fastoma_speciesdata.description: TSV file with additional information about the proteomes, must contain "Name" column if provided.
fastoma_speciesdata.help_text: Optional (but recommended) TSV file with additional information about the proteomes. If specified, the file must contain at least the column "Name". It's values must match the filenames of the proteomes (without file extension). We suggest to include the following columns in addition: - NCBITaxonId (needed to map cross-references reliably)

production_oma_input_data.title: Production OMA Input data
production_oma_input_data.description: Input files genereated from an OMA Production run

pairwise_orthologs_folder.description: Pairwise Orthologs (only by Standard OMA pipeline)

hog_orthoxml.description: Hierarchcial orthologous groups (HOGs) in orthoxml format

known_domains.description: Folder containing known domain assignments files

go_gaf.description: Gene Ontology annotations (GAF format). This can the GOA database or a glob pattern with local files in gaf format.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

custom_config_version.description: version of configuration base to include (nf-core configs)

custom_config_base.description: location where to look for nf-core/configs
